TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit X509SecurityTokenProvider extends System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider implements class System.IDisposable
Public Class X509SecurityTokenProvider Inherits SecurityTokenProvider Implements IDisposable
type X509SecurityTokenProvider = class inherit SecurityTokenProvider interface IDisposable

Docs.summary: Represents a security token provider that provides security tokens for a SOAP message sender.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In most instances it is not necessary to call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider> class directly, as it is called when a client sends a SOAP message that requires a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> security token. Specifically, a client specifies the type of security token required, using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method to get a security token. When the security token required is an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> security token, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method.

Docs.related: How To: Create a Custom Token

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.param: The to get a security token for.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified X.509 certificate.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method gets a security token based on the certificate specified in the `certificate` parameter.

Docs.param: One of the values that specifies the certificate store location.
One of the values that specifies the certificate store name.
One of the values that specifies how to search the certificate store.
The value used to find the X.509 certificate in the certificate store.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by getting an X.509 certificate from the specified certificate store criteria.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method gets a security token based on the certificate that matches the specified certificate store criteria.

Docs.exception:
No certificates match the specified criteria.
-or-
More than one certificate matches the specified criteria.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method gets a security token based on the certificate represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider.Certificate%2A> property.

Protected Overrides Function GetTokenCore (timeout As TimeSpan) As SecurityToken

Docs.param: A that specifies the timeout value for the message that gets the security token.
Docs.summary: Gets a security token using the X.509 certificate specified in the constructor.
Docs.returns: The that represents the security token to get.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method is called by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class when a client sends a SOAP message and an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> security token is required.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method.
